skill.name: dast-nuclei
skill.description: Fast, template-based vulnerability scanning using ProjectDiscovery's Nuclei with extensive community templates covering CVEs, OWASP Top 10, misconfigurations, and security issues across web applications, APIs, and infrastructure. Use when: (1) Performing rapid vulnerability scanning with automated CVE detection, (2) Testing for known vulnerabilities and security misconfigurations in web apps and APIs, (3) Running template-based security checks in CI/CD pipelines with customizable severity thresholds, (4) Creating custom security templates for organization-specific vulnerability patterns, (5) Scanning multiple targets efficiently with concurrent execution and rate limiting controls.

security_audit.summary: Documentation-only skill providing guidance for legitimate Nuclei DAST tool. The static analysis findings are false positives - command examples in documentation, placeholder credential variables in config templates, and URLs to security documentation. Nuclei is a well-known open-source security tool from ProjectDiscovery used for legitimate vulnerability scanning. No malicious patterns, credential exfiltration, or attack tooling present.

content.user_title: Scan web apps for vulnerabilities with Nuclei
content.value_statement: Automated vulnerability scanning identifies security issues in web applications and APIs. Nuclei uses 7000+ community templates to detect CVEs, misconfigurations, and OWASP Top 10 vulnerabilities quickly and accurately.
actual_capabilities: Run automated CVE and vulnerability scans against web applications and APIs
Execute template-based security checks with severity filtering (critical, high, medium, low)
Perform authenticated scanning using Bearer tokens, API keys, and session cookies
Generate SARIF, JSON, and JSONL reports for CI/CD integration and security dashboards
Create custom security templates for organization-specific vulnerability patterns
Integrate with GitHub Actions, Docker, and other CI/CD platforms
limitations: Requires Nuclei to be installed separately (go install or Docker)
Does not perform manual penetration testing or exploitation of findings
Template quality depends on community-contributed rules and may produce false positives
Scanning requires explicit authorization for targets you do not own

best_practices: Always obtain written authorization before scanning systems you do not own
Use conservative rate limits (50-100 requests per second) for production environments
Verify critical findings manually before raising security incidents or creating tickets
anti_patterns: Scanning third-party services or competitor systems without explicit permission
Using high concurrency settings that may overwhelm target applications or trigger WAF blocks
Ignoring false positive rates and not validating findings before reporting

faq.question: Does this skill install Nuclei?
faq.answer: No, you must install Nuclei separately using go install github.com/projectdiscovery/nuclei/v3/cmd/nuclei@latest or Docker.

faq.question: What severity levels does Nuclei support?
faq.answer: Critical, high, medium, low, and info. Use -severity critical,high to filter for important findings only.

faq.question: Can I integrate this with GitHub Actions?
faq.answer: Yes, use the nuclei-action or the provided GitHub Actions template with SARIF export for GitHub Security tab integration.

faq.question: Are my scan results kept private?
faq.answer: Results are stored locally on your system. The skill does not transmit data externally except to the targets you specify.

faq.question: How do I reduce false positives?
faq.answer: Use severity filtering, exclude tags (-etags tech,info), and verify findings manually using the false positive guide.

faq.question: How does this compare to other DAST tools?
faq.answer: Nuclei uses template-based scanning for speed and customization. Combine with ZAP or Burp Suite for comprehensive coverage.
